entry.title: Second Half 2025: What‚Äôs New in SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central?
entry.content:
The Second Half 2025 Release delivers many exciting innovations within SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central. We are introducing new features and capabilities designed to enhance experiences and boost efficiency for all users. Here is a snapshot of what you can expect to see in this release:

New People Profile
We are excited to announce that we have completed the refresh of the People Profile view experience, incorporating valuable customer input and feedback. In addition, customers can now leverage optimized experiences for updating employee information and navigating historical changes. New full-page views enable users to quickly insert, edit, or delete records, further simplifying employee data management. Learn more about the new People Profile experience here.

New edit and history experiences in the People Profile

 

Mass changes to job relationships
We are further expanding the capabilities of the mass data management tool to support updates to job relationships. Admins can leverage a simplified UI to quickly initiate changes for multiple employees without the need for technical expertise.

Mass changes to job relationships

 

Enhanced alerts
We have enhanced SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central alerts (emails and home page to-dos) with the ability to include additional employee-specific information, such as work permit type, document number, and exact expiry date. This added context provides users with a clearer understanding of task urgency and supports more informed decisions.

Configurable org chart cards
Customers can now tailor the information shown on org chart cards to their specific needs by choosing which employee detail to display, such as location, department, or a custom field. This enables a more customized org chart experience that is aligned to organizational requirements.

Org chart card configuration

 

Workforce composition and compensation insights
As part of the initial release of People Intelligence in SAP Business Data Cloud, we are delivering ready-to-run intelligent apps for workforce composition and compensation. Powered by data from SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central, customers can leverage actionable AI-driven workforce insights to drive informed people and business decisions.

Workforce composition insights

 

Learn more
These are just a few of the many innovations in the SAP SuccessFactors Second Half 2025 Release. To learn more, check out the resources below:

  • Visit the SAP SuccessFactors Product Release & Road Map Information page for release documentation, product videos, and solution area blogs
  • Watch the 2H 2025 Release Highlights Overview Video, featuring Bianka Woelke, GVP Head of Application Product Management
  • Discover all innovations in the What's New Viewer

entry.title: Let‚Äôs Talk About UI5: Your Questions Will Steer Our December UI5ers Live Session
entry.content:
This December, we‚Äôre flipping the script for our final UI5ers live session of the year. Instead of us presenting, we want you to set the agenda. Join us on Thursday, 4th December, at 15:15 CET, for a special ‚ÄúAsk Us Anything‚Äù session where Stefan Beck, Andreas Kunz, Peter Muessig, and Margot Wollny will be ready to tackle your questions on UI5‚Äôs future, architecture, and more.

This is more than just a Q&A; it‚Äôs a conversation. Your questions, your feedback, and your perspective are what help guide the evolution of UI5. We genuinely want to know what‚Äôs on your mind, what challenges you, and what you‚Äôre excited about.

Help Us Shape the Conversation

To make this session as insightful as possible, we invite you to send us your questions in advance. We‚Äôre especially looking for questions that spark discussion around broader topics. To get you thinking, here are a few examples of the kinds of questions we‚Äôd love to explore:

  • üó∫Ô∏è The Future & Roadmap:
    • ‚ÄúWhat are the long-term plans for Web Components in UI5 applications?‚Äù
    • ‚ÄúAre there still plans for an open-source tool for theming?‚Äù
  • üèóÔ∏è Architecture & Design Decisions:
    • ‚ÄúWhy does the architecture of the OData V4 model differ so much from the one for the OData V2 model?‚Äù
    • "Could you explain the trade-offs considered when designing the current routing system?‚Äù
  • üëçüëéConstructive Feedback (The Good and The Bad):‚Äú
    • "I find the data binding syntax incredibly powerful. Are there plans to expand on this?‚Äù
    • ‚ÄúManaging dependencies across multiple libraries can feel complex. Have you considered ways to simplify this?‚Äù

Why Send Your Questions in Advance?

While we will absolutely take questions live, submitting them beforehand helps us make the session better for everyone. It allows our team to:

  • Prepare thoughtful, in-depth answers instead of just off-the-cuff replies.
  • Spot common themes and group related questions to address a topic more comprehensively.
  • Bring in the right expert from the team if a question requires specific knowledge.
  • Prepare a quick code sample or visual aid if it helps clarify a complex concept.

Your early submissions will directly contribute to a more valuable and well-prepared discussion.

Ready to Ask? Here‚Äôs How:

To ensure our team has time to review everything, please send your questions by Monday, 1st December 2025. You have a few options:

  • Comments below: Simply add your question as a comment on this article
  • Email: If you prefer, send your question to us at openui5@sap.com

We are truly looking forward to this open dialogue and hearing directly from you. Let‚Äôs make this a fantastic final session of the year, together.

entry.title: Re: SuccessFactors¬†via Intelligent Services to publish new hire data to SAP Advanced Event Mesh
entry.content:
Has anyone successfully connected SAP Event Mesh (EMIS) with SuccessFactors using Intelligent Service Center?

I've encountered an issue with URL encoding of the topic/queue component in the REST messaging protocol endpoint URL, which occurs in both Integration Center (Custom Integration) and Event Connector. The proper URL construction for REST endpoints is documented here: https://help.sap.com/docs/event-mesh/event-mesh/use-rest-apis-to-send-and-receive-messages

Here's what I'm experiencing:

  • Event Connector: The URL is decoded prematurely during editing of the endpoint URL field
  • Integration Center: The URL is decoded at runtime, which is visible in the error logs

Both approaches fail with a 404 error (URL not found). This behavior is consistent with what happens when sending a non-URL-encoded queue/topic component via Bruno/Postman‚Äîalso resulting in a 404 error.

This problem is referenced in SAP's knowledge base, but no solution has been provided: https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3120396

best regards,

Mateusz

entry.title: Re: Unified Destination Setup for Accessing Multiple ODat...
entry.content:
Good day @sawa-tomoki 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at the following references for further details.

Configure Communication Management, Configure Communication Arrangements, Extending Existing SAP Solutions Using SAP BTP    , Integration with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

To summarise, external access to OData APIs is managed in public cloud strictly through communication scenarios and communication arrangements. Each of which:

  • Represents a defined set of released APIs grouped by business area,
  • Is secured by its own technical communication user and OAuth token endpoint, and
  • Is governed by clean-core principle, which ensures APIs are only exposed in the scope defined by managed communication scenarios.

Each time you create a communication arrangement (e.g., SAP_COM_0109 for Sales Orders, SAP_COM_0008 for Purchase Orders, etc.), SAP Cloud Identity and the communication management layer generate:  a unique Service Key/URL endpoint and a dedicated OAuth client in your S4H tenant. Because of this architectural isolation, each destination in BTP maps to one communication arrangement and therefore one API set.

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Business rule for Variable Pay and/or Rewards&Recogni...
entry.content:
Hi @tatiana_caraima 

There are no issues in integrating Comp and VarPay with Time Off as long as you do the following: 

https://community.sap.com/t5/human-capital-management-blog-posts-by-sap/time-off-integration-in-compensation-eligibility-rules/ba-p/13579851

 

Aligned with David on using a VarPay template for the rest and not an effective dated MDF because of the following known hurdles (which I have mentionned on other threads on the community chat before, especially the one with inactive users) :

 

  • The first one is that MDFs do not behave like another JobInfo or CompInfo when mapped to the comp module rules. They need a record in them effective 1/1/1900 (or at the latest effective on the day of the record that's active in EC entering the Varpay program start date) before the actual record loaded by the customer to return expected results when applied. 
    • For example if the VarPay template has a program start date of 1/1/2025 and you load only one MDF record effective 5/1/2025 expecting the varpay record retrieved for this employee to show only from 5/1/2025 to 12/31/2025, it will not work. You would need the MDF to have a first record of 1/1/1900 or at the latest as of the start date of the Job Info record which is effective on varpay program start date of 1/1/2025 (for example : 10/1/2024 - position title change).
    • An easy workaround for this limitation is to use Integration Center with a nightly job that would add a record with start-date= Hire date for each employee.

 

  • The second one is that MDFs mapped to Comp/Varpay eligibility rules will not work for Inactive employees. 
    • For example you've got someone who was eligible on 1/1/2025, then had a data change on 4/1/2025 to make them ineligible that was loaded into the effective dated MDF object (with above setup), then finally on 6/1/2025 the employee retired. When customer CompAdmin imports employee history from EC in the first quarter of 2026 this employee is now Retired (= INACTIVE in UDF) and as a consequence the system won't trim the varpay employee history to only retrieve 1/1/2025 to 3/31/2025, it will still retrieve 1/1/2025 to 5/31/2025 which is not the expected result. That's because MDFs don't process currently inactive employees in business rules the way the Comp module is built to process them.

 

For these reasons I try to only use effective-dated MDF objects to retrieve data in worksheets or to publish data back and NOT for eligibility purposes. For complex eligibility topics I always push to have custom fields with on Save business rules built in EC directly (for example in the Time Off integration case explaned above) instead of using effective-dated MDFs.

 

Best, 
Xavier

entry.title: Automating Data Validation in SAP ABAP: Comparing CSV Prices with Sales Order Table
entry.content:
Compare CSV Prices with SAP Sales Orders (VBAK) in ABAP 

SITUATION 

          During a data migration and sales audit project, the business team provided a CSV file containing a list of price values (net amounts). 
They wanted to verify whether all these prices existed in SAP Sales Orders (VBAK table) before approving the upload. 

Manually comparing thousands of prices between the CSV and SAP was time-consuming, error-prone, and repetitive. 

So, I decided to build a small ABAP utility to automate the comparison process between the uploaded CSV data and the SAP table VBAK-NETWR. 

TASK 

Develop an ABAP program that: 

  1. Uploads a CSV file containing a list of prices. 
  2. Validates and cleans the data (removing extra characters, symbols, etc.). 
  3. Compare those values with VBAK-NETWR (Sales Order Net Value). 
  4. Highlights of which prices don‚Äôt exist in SAP. 

In short ‚Äî a quick data validation tool to assist business users before migration or audit. 

ACTION  

I developed the ABAP report with the following major steps: 

File Selection 

I added a parameter to select the CSV file using F4_FILENAME: 

This gives a simple ‚Äúbrowse file‚Äù popup. 

File Upload Using GUI_UPLOAD 

Once selected, the CSV file is uploaded into an internal table: 

Data Validation and Cleaning 

I ensured uploaded data was numeric and properly formatted: 

Then, invalid or alphabetic entries triggered an error message: 

Conversion and Rounding 

Each value was converted into a packed number (decimal 2 places): 

Comparison with SAP Table (VBAK) 

I fetched NETWR values from VBAK for all uploaded prices: 

Then compared using binary search: 

Result Display 

If all values exist, 

Otherwise, missing prices are displayed neatly using. 

TABLES: vbak.

TYPES: BEGIN OF ty_log_a,
         price_str(50) TYPE c,
       END OF ty_log_a,

       BEGIN OF ty_log,
         price  TYPE vbak-netwr,
         status TYPE string,
       END OF ty_log.

DATA: it_log       TYPE TABLE OF ty_log_a,
      lt_final_log TYPE TABLE OF ty_log,
      ls_final_log TYPE ty_log,
      lv_file      TYPE string,
      lv_temp_prc  TYPE vbak-netwr,
      lv_invalid   TYPE abap_bool VALUE abap_false.

PARAMETERS: p_file TYPE rlgrap-filename OBLIGATORY.

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
* F4 Help for File Selection
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
AT SELECTION-SCREEN ON VALUE-REQUEST FOR p_file.
  CALL FUNCTION 'F4_FILENAME'
    EXPORTING
      field_name = 'P_FILE'
    IMPORTING
      file_name  = p_file.

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Start of Selection
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
START-OF-SELECTION.

  MOVE p_file TO lv_file.

  IF lv_file IS INITIAL.
    MESSAGE 'Please select a CSV file to upload.' TYPE 'E'.
  ENDIF.

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Upload CSV File
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
  CALL FUNCTION 'GUI_UPLOAD'
    EXPORTING
      filename = lv_file
      filetype = 'ASC'
    TABLES
      data_tab = it_log
    EXCEPTIONS
      OTHERS = 5.

  IF sy-subrc <> 0 OR it_log IS INITIAL.
    MESSAGE 'Error uploading CSV file or file is empty.' TYPE 'E'.
  ENDIF.

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Validate and Convert each row
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
DATA lv_temp_price TYPE p LENGTH 15 DECIMALS 2.
DATA lv_temp_str   TYPE string.

LOOP AT it_log INTO DATA(ls_upload).

  lv_temp_str = ls_upload-price_str.
  CONDENSE lv_temp_str NO-GAPS.

  " Replace common formatting symbols
  REPLACE ALL OCCURRENCES OF '.' IN lv_temp_str WITH ''.
  REPLACE ALL OCCURRENCES OF ',' IN lv_temp_str WITH '.'.

  " Check if string is numeric (with decimal allowed)
  IF lv_temp_str CS 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ'
     OR lv_temp_str CS 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'
     OR lv_temp_str CS '!@#$%^&*()_+=<>?/;:''"[]{}|\'.
    lv_invalid = abap_true.
    EXIT.
  ENDIF.

  TRY.
      lv_temp_price = lv_temp_str.
      lv_temp_price = ROUND( val = lv_temp_price dec = 2 ).
    CATCH cx_sy_conversion_no_number.
      lv_invalid = abap_true.
      EXIT.
  ENDTRY.

  IF lv_temp_price LT 0.
    lv_invalid = abap_true.
    EXIT.
  ENDIF.

  ls_final_log-price = lv_temp_price.
  APPEND ls_final_log TO lt_final_log.

ENDLOOP.

IF lv_invalid = abap_true.
  MESSAGE 'Invalid file format: contains non-numeric or incorrect values.' TYPE 'E'.
  EXIT.
ENDIF.

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Fetch NETWR from VBAK (match uploaded prices)
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
SELECT netwr
  FROM vbak
  INTO TABLE @DATA(lt_vbak)
  FOR ALL ENTRIES IN @LT_final_log
  WHERE netwr = @LT_final_log-price.

SORT lt_vbak BY netwr.
SORT lt_final_log BY price.

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Compare uploaded values with VBAK
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
DATA lt_not_exist TYPE TABLE OF ty_log.

LOOP AT lt_final_log INTO DATA(ls_log).
  lv_temp_prc = ls_log-price.
  READ TABLE lt_vbak INTO DATA(ls_vbak)
       WITH KEY netwr = lv_temp_prc
       BINARY SEARCH.

  IF sy-subrc <> 0.
    ls_log-status = 'Does not exist in VBAK (NETWR)'.
    APPEND ls_log TO lt_not_exist.
  ENDIF.
ENDLOOP.

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Display result
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
IF lt_not_exist IS INITIAL.
  WRITE: / 'All uploaded NETWR values exist in VBAK.'.
ELSE.
  cl_demo_output=>display( EXPORTING data = lt_not_exist ).
ENDIF.

RESULT 

  • The program automated what previously took hours of manual validation. 
  • Business users can now upload any CSV and get an instant comparison result. 
    Data accuracy improved significantly during the migration audit. 
    The utility is reusable for any numeric field validation across SAP tables. 

Conclusion 

This utility bridges the gap between external data and SAP validation. 
It‚Äôs fast, accurate, and ensures data consistency across systems. 

üî• A simple, powerful ABAP report that proves ‚Äî automation is better than manual checking!

entry.title: Re: üì¢ Survey: ABAP Naming Conventions
entry.content:
This is a very interesting topic and something I am currently working on. I‚Äôve developed a Fiori App that functions as a naming convention generator, users input mandatory or optional fields, and the app produces the appropriate naming convention for a given object.

In the current design, the JavaScript backend relies heavily on hardcoded static values, which isn‚Äôt ideal. It would be much better to maintain a rules table or a dedicated app for managing these rules, as updating hardcoded values manually is both time-consuming and inefficient.

Some time ago, I also submitted an improvement request to SAP titled ‚ÄúPrecheck Naming Convention for ABAP/FIORI Development Artifacts During Creation.‚Äù The idea suggests that SAP could introduce a BADI, allowing customers to define their own rules for creating technical objects ensuring that developers can only create objects that follow predefined naming standards. Unfortunately, despite receiving strong community support, it‚Äôs still waiting in the queue. If you could help push this forward from your end, it would be greatly appreciated.

entry.title: Re: Assigning account keys to condition types in SAP Publ...
entry.content:
Hello @Mers 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at the following references for further details.

Revenue Account Determination, Integration with Sales and Distribution (SD)

In public cloud the configuration through VKOA or SPRO is not available directly. There has been a shift to using Business Configuration (SSCUI) process which you can access through the Manage Your Solution Acitivities app.

In short: you should, define Account Keys,  Assign G/L Accounts (SSCUI100297), use pricing procedure linkage (SSCUI 102345) and maintain assignment groups in your master data.

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: SAP Inside Track Paraguay CDE 2025: Reinventando la Experiencia del Talento- SAP SuccessFactors
entry.content:
El pasado evento SAP Inside Track Paraguay SITCDE2025 nos regal√≥ una charla inspiradora de la mano de Carolina Salinas Glikin, COO de Qactions System, quien con m√°s de 20 a√±os de experiencia en el ecosistema SAP, nos llev√≥ en un viaje desde los "grises d√≠as del SAP duro" hasta la revoluci√≥n actual de la gesti√≥n del talento.

De Empleados a Personas: El Cambio de Paradigma
Carolina comenz√≥ compartiendo su propia transformaci√≥n: de profesional de recursos humanos a especialista en sistemas, impulsada por la necesidad de optimizar procesos. Pero lo m√°s revelador fue c√≥mo SAP SuccessFactors representa un cambio fundamental en la filosof√≠a empresarial

"Ya no somos empleados, somos personas, colaboradores, talento. Y el coraz√≥n de las empresas somos todos nosotros."

Este cambio no es solo sem√°ntico. SAP desarroll√≥ SuccessFactors con profesionales de RR.HH., no solo con ingenieros, creando una plataforma que entiende las necesidades reales del √°rea.

SITCDE2025

El Ecosistema Modular: Crecer a tu Ritmo
Una de las revelaciones m√°s importantes: no necesitas implementar todo de una vez. SAP SuccessFactors es modular, permitiendo a las empresas:

Core HR - La Base S√≥lida
Employee Central: El coraz√≥n del sistema donde vive toda la informaci√≥n del colaborador
Employee Central Payroll: Liquidaci√≥n de sueldos inteligente que calcula retroactivos autom√°ticamente (¬°adi√≥s a las pesadillas de c√°lculos manuales!)
Time Tracking: Gesti√≥n de tiempos que incluso permite fichadas desde el celular con geolocalizaci√≥n

Gesti√≥n del Talento - El Crecimiento

Onboarding/Recruiting: Desde atraer talento hasta que el colaborador se sienta parte desde el d√≠a uno
Performance & Goals: Evaluaciones de desempe√±o con IA generativa que ayuda a redactar objetivos
Learning y Compensation: Capacitaci√≥n continua y compensaciones justas basadas en resultados

La Autogesti√≥n: Empoderando a las Personas
Carolina destac√≥ un punto crucial: la autogesti√≥n no es una carga para el colaborador, es un empoderamiento. Cuando un colaborador puede:

Solicitar vacaciones desde su celular
Ver cu√°ndo debe regresar autom√°ticamente
Cargar cambios de domicilio
Acceder a su informaci√≥n desde cualquier lugar

Se siente m√°s parte de la empresa, liberando a RR.HH. para enfocarse en lo estrat√©gico: detectar talento, dise√±ar planes de carrera, gestionar la cultura organizacional.

SITCDE2025
Innovaci√≥n que Sorprende: JOULE
La cereza del pastel fue JOULE, el asistente de IA que permite interactuar con todo el sistema en lenguaje natural. Imagina preguntarle: "¬øC√≥mo cargo mis vacaciones?" y que √©l no solo te explique, sino que te las cargue despu√©s de verificar disponibilidad y posibles conflictos con tu equipo.

Anal√≠tica que Transforma Datos en Decisiones
Con SAP Analytics Cloud integrado, los dashboards ya no son aburridos reportes en Excel. Ahora puedes visualizar en tiempo real:

-Distribuci√≥n de g√©nero por pa√≠s, ciudad o sucursal
-Efectividad de capacitaciones
-Resultados de evaluaciones de desempe√±o
-Y todo esto sin costo adicional

SITCDE2025

El Mensaje Final
"No se trata solo de gestionar personas, sino de construir experiencias que impulsen el √©xito organizacional a largo plazo."

SAP SuccessFactors no es solo un sistema de RR.HH., es una plataforma de experiencias que pone a las personas en el centro, permitiendo que las empresas crezcan de manera sostenible con su gente, no a pesar de ella.

¬øLo mejor? Todo es escalable, modular, y se integra nativamente con otros sistemas SAP y no-SAP. Una soluci√≥n pensada para el mundo actual, donde el talento es el verdadero diferenciador competitivo.
¬øTu empresa est√° lista para reinventar la experiencia de su talento?

Gracias a Qactions System por compartir esta visi√≥n y al equipo organizador del SAP Inside Track Paraguay por hacer posible estos espacios de aprendizaje. #SITCDE2025

entry.title: What's new for Production Planning in SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud 2025
entry.content:
SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud has been officially released, and many new feature were delivered for production planning. From UI improvements to the MRP Cockpit Fiori apps to new Business Add-Ins available for MRP and production orders, this blog provides an overview of those new features that are available in the latest SAP S/4HANA release.

Improvements for MRP Cockpit Fiori Apps

Several improvements were delivered for the MRP Cockpit Fiori Apps Monitor Material Coverage - Net Segments (F0247A), Monitor Material Coverage - Net and Individual Segments (F2101A) and Manage Material Coverage (F0251A), bringing additional functionalities that util now were only available in the Stock/Requirements List, and also innovations that will mimic features originally available in the MRP List. 

Rescheduling and Cancelling of Proposals

Fiori Apps Monitor Material Coverage - Net Segments (F0247A) and Monitor Material Coverage - Net and Individual Segments (F2101A) were enhanced to display information about the number of rescheduling proposals that were generated for a specific material.

These apps will now display of the number of rescheduling proposals, and new filters were also introduced to allow users to filter for materials with specific rescheduling messages. The following figure shows the new fields and the new filters in the app Monitor Material Coverage.


Figure 1: Rescheduling Proposals in Monitor Material Coverage

Fiori app Manage Material Coverage has been also enhanced with new actions that will help users to resolve coverage issues and make sure requirements can be met as planned:

  • Proposals to reschedule MRP elements to an earlier date (reschedule in)
  • Proposals to reschedule MRP elements to a later date (reschedule out)
  • Proposals to cancel MRP elements (cancel process)

The following figure shows and example of the action Reschedule Out, for a purchase order with a rescheduling message:


Figure 2: Rescheduling actions in Manage Material Coverage

 

Last MRP Run

Fiori Apps Monitor Material Coverage and Manage Material Coverage were also enhanced to show the date of the last MRP Run, and to allow users to filter for material segments using the date of the Last MRP Run. The following figures show the filter and the field in Monitor Material Coverage and Manage Material Coverage.


Figure 3: Last MRP Run in Monitor Material Coverage

 

Figure 4: Last MRP Run in Manage Material Coverage

 

Planning Time Fence and Manual Firming Date

Another enhancement to the Monitor Material Coverage and Manage Material Coverage Fiori apps was the introduction of the Planning Time Fence and the possibility to set or change a Manual Time Fence.

New filters and columns for MRP type and planning time fence were added into the Material Coverage app, as we can see in the Figure below.


Figure 5: Planning Time Fence and MRP Type in Monitor Material Coverage

 

As we can see in Figure 6, Fiori App Manage Material Coverage now can show the Planning Time Fence, and users will also have the possibility to edit the Planning Time Fence.  

Figure 6: Planning Time Fence in Manage Material Coverage


Accept MRP Run Result

SAP S/4HANA 2025 also introduced a new feature called Accept the MRP results, allowing the planner to mark materials for which the MRP result has been already evaluated.

A new filter has been already introduced in Fiori App Monitor Material Coverage, so that the planner can filter for material segments where the MRP result has been already accepted or not, and there is also a new column called MRP Result Accepted, as we can see in Figure 7.

Figure 7: MRP Result Accepted in Fiori App Monitor Material Coverage

 

Fiori app Manage Material Coverage has also been enhanced with a button that allows the planner to Accept the MRP Results, or revoke the Acceptance of MRP results, as shown in Figure 8.  

Figure 8: Button Accept MRP Result in Fiori App Manage Material Coverage

 

This feature has been also introduced in both collect and individual access of the Stock/Requirements List (transactions MD04 and MD07), as I described in my blog Accept/Revoke MRP Run results in the Stock/Requirements List and MRP Fiori Apps, and it is available for earlier releases, as described in the blog. However, only as of SAP S/4HANA 2025 users will have the ability to mass Accept and Revoke the MRP Results from the Collective Access of the Stock/Requirements List, as shown in Figure 9.


Figure 9: Mass acceptance of MRP results in the Stock/Requirements List.

 

Downporting new features to SAP S/4HANA 2023

Some of the new features listed above can be also introduce in SAP S/4HANA 2023 with the implementation of the following notes:

No.

SAP Note

Description

1

3586336

SAP- Production Planning- Supporting Features- Rescheduling Proposals, Planning time fence and Last MRP Run.

2

3592002

SAP- Production Planning- Rescheduling Proposals, Planning time fence and Last MRP Run in Monitor material coverage- Net & Individual segments Fiori Application ( F2101A )

3

3592003

SAP- Production Planning- Rescheduling Proposals, Planning time fence and Last MRP Run in Monitor material coverage- Net segments ( F0247A )

4

3591572

SAP- Production Planning- Rescheduling Proposals, Planning time fence and Last MRP Run in Manage material coverage Fiori Application (F0251A)

 

MRP Live 

Technical improvements were also delivered for MRP Live in SAP S/4HANA 2025, including new BAdIs and the improvements in the integration of documents with PP/DS and IBP.

Business Transaction Events in MRP Live

SAP S/4HANA introduced a new feature in MRP Live, that allows the creation of business transaction events (BTEs) for business documents created within MRP Live (e.g. planned orders, purchase requisitions, scheduling agreements and stock transfer requisitions) enabling post-processing steps for other applications like PP/DS, IBP.

In previous releases, materials for which documents had to be integrated to PP/DS or IBP had to be planned by MRP Live in ABAP instead of HANA, because documents generated or changed by MRP were integrated by means of an RFC. With the new integration using BTE events, those materials can be planned in HANA, which an improved MRP Live performance.

For example, if we activate Advanced Planning for a material, and we choose the option PP/DS Display Only for the scope limitation, this material would be planned in ABAP by MRP Live. As of SAP S/4HANA 2025, we can use BTE events to integrate those documents, allowing the material to be planned in HANA.

The setting to activate the integration with BTE can be found in transaction PPHMRPSET, as we can see in Figure 10.


Figure 10: Setting to activate Business Transaction Events in MRP Live.

New BAdIs for MRP

  • Adjustment of Planned Order Component Data during BOM Explosion (PPH_PLDORD_COMP_ADJ):  This new BAdI allows you to modify the storage location and production supply area of components in planned orders during BOM explosion in the following processes:

    • Planning run of material requirements planning and master production scheduling

    • Manual planned order creation
    • Backflush for repetitive manufacturing without planned order

  • Additional Parameters for Navigation Profile (MD_NAVIGATION_ADJUSTüòû With this new BAdI you can change the parameter IDs for transactions which are maintained in Customizing activity Define Navigation Profiles. Navigation profiles enable you to navigate faster and more flexibly between transactions, and with the new BAdI you can use more than only three parameter IDs.

 

Shop-Floor Control

Besides the already mentioned improvements for MRP, SAP S/4HANA 2025 also brought improvements for Shop-Floor Control, including a better handling for partial consumption posted from EWM, and new technical objects, like RAP Business Objects and Data Products. 

 

Partial Consumption and Split for Error Handling for Automatic Goods Movement, COGI

SAP S/4HANA 2025 also introduced a new feature that enables partial retrograde goods issue for non-batched and non-serialized components in embedded SAP Extended Warehouse Management, checking availability in the bin of the production supply area during the manufacturing process

This feature allows postprocessing of error records from automatic goods movements (COGI transaction) only for unavailable quantities of components, and it works for discrete and repetitive manufacturing. It will enable as-is partial goods movement between SAP EWM and production during synchronous goods movement processes, increasing PSA stock control, reducing clerical work, and improving accuracy of stock data. Figure 11 shows the setting use to activate this new feature in the Production Scheduling Profile.


Figure 11: Goods Issue Quantity Split setting in the Production Scheduling Profile

 

Example:

  • 3 EA of component KOMPK1-01 are available in the bin in production supply area, as shown in Figure 12.


Figure 12: 3 EA of component available in the Supply Area.

 

  • Figure 13 shows that the backflush of the component for a production order requires 12 EA,


Figure 13: Backflush requires 12 EA of the component.

 

  • When we post the backflush for the production order, 3 EA of component KOMPK1-01 are issued, as shown in Figure 14.


Figure 14: Backflush was posted and the consumption of 3 EA has been posted.

 

  • As we have activated the Goods Issue Quantity Split in the Production Scheduling Profile, the remaining quantity of 9 EA went into Postprocessing of Error Records from Automatic Goods Movements (transaction COGI), as shown in Figure 15.

 


Figure 15: Postprocessing of the remaining quantity in COGI

 

BAdI for Initialization of Order Component on Creation

With the new Business Add-In (BAdI), Order Component - Initialization on Creation (PPH_PRODORD_COMP_ADJ) you can fill the material planning relevance and the bulk indicator at the order component (reservation) level when creating an order.

 

RAP Business Objects for Production Orders

SAP S/4HANA 2025 also brought new technical objects that will help customers to make sure that custom developments are clean core compatible. New RAP Business Objects were introduced for Production Orders, Process Orders and Routings, enabling cloud-native APIs for SAP BusinessObjects in production execution and on-stack extensibility for Manufacturing.



Figure 16: New Production and Process Order RAP BOs 

 

Manufacturing Data Products

A SAP data product is a pre-packaged dataset that is ready for consumption by applications for analytics, AI, and other business intelligence purposes. A comprehensive set of ERP data products sourced from SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition is now available, providing structured insights into manufacturing execution:

  • Production version
  • Work center
  • Manufacturing codes
  • Production confirmation
  • Production order
  • Enterprise resource capacity
  • Production routing]

SAP API Hub provides more information about the Manufacturing Data Products.

 

See also:

Planning Time Fence and Last MRP Run

Accept Planning Result of MRP Run

Rescheduling Proposals for MRP Elements

Business Transaction Events in MRP Live

BAdI for Adjustment of Planned Order Component Data during BOM Explosion

BAdI for Allowing Additional Parameters for Navigation Profile

BAdI for Initialization of Order Component on Creation

Partial Goods Issue for Component Consumption in Manufacturing

API Hub

 

Brought to you by the SAP S/4HANA Regional Implementation Group

entry.title: Cancel maintenance confirmation to an order with several confirmations in cloud public edition 2508
entry.content:
Hello all,

I found an issue in transaction IW45 in S4Hana cloud public edition selecting an order with several confirmations.

There is no issue when the order has one confirmation and you indicate the order number in the selection screen. But, when you select an order with multiple confirmations, they are displayed in the screen as a list with some details but I haven't found the way to select the one you want to cancel. You can mark de confirmation to cancel using the radio button but there is no way to cancel it. When you hit the Save button an error message appears saying: "Saving not necessary - no confirmations were created" (Message no. RU441).

Please help.

Thank you.

entry.title: Re: Default Formula Keys, Activity Types, and Activity Un...
entry.content:
Dear @byd,

Point 1. In CBC, Define Formulas for Work Centers(102002) all work centers provided by SAP are available.

 

 

Also important settings Define standard value key(102003), Define control key(102001).

 

 

Point 2. There isn‚Äôt a fixed, SAP-mandated list of activity types in Public Edition. You create them in Manage Activity Types (Fiori app) and assign them to cost centers and work centers. SAP generally doesn‚Äôt deliver permanent ‚Äûglobal‚Äù activity types because they‚Äôre org-specific.

More details below:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/c56f622a2edf491b9f1b596b55587009/70c1b4f3e8bc4ea79a97e2c0cd40a0c5.html

You can also use Manage Cost Rates Actual(F3422)/Plan(F3162) for broader rate maintenance and remember in Public Cloud comes with one controlling area; make sure you‚Äôre creating the activity types in that area.

More details below:

https://fioriappslibrary.hana.ondemand.com/sap/fix/externalViewer/#/detail/Apps('F3422')/S34

https://fioriappslibrary.hana.ondemand.com/sap/fix/externalViewer/#/detail/Apps('F3162')/S34

Point 3. Activity types can use any unit from your system‚Äôs standard UoM catalog (the same cross-application list used for materials, etc.). Typical ones are H (hours), MIN (minutes), PC (pieces), KG etc.

In Public Cloud, the complete list is visible/maintained in CBC, Check Units of Measurement (102179).

 

SAP Note‚Äôs: you‚Äôll see the unit in activity master data and in costing, there‚Äôs even about differing display units in cost estimates, which underscores that the unit you choose on the activity type matters.

More details below:

https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3356842

Best Regards,

Dawid

entry.title: Re: Header Text is flowing to GR Document from Service en...
entry.content:
Hi,

In SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, the Header Note and Header Text fields in a Service Entry Sheet serve only as informational fields:

  • Header Note ‚Äì internal use, visible within your organization.

  • Header Text ‚Äì external use, can appear on supplier-related forms.

By design, these texts do not flow to follow-on documents such as the Material Document or Accounting Document.
Each document type has its own text objects and there is no standard text transfer between them.

You may also refer to Manage Service Entry Sheets ‚Äì Lean Services

Best regards,

SAP Support

entry.title: Question about tx ABAVN, ABAON, ABZON
entry.content:
Hi everyone

We are currently implementing SAP S4HANA 2023. In transactions ABAVN, ABAON, and ABZON, is it possible to post a fixed asset to more than one ledger?

We have five ledgers, but we need to post to only two, L4 and L5, for several fixed assets. Is it possible to do this in both ledgers, or can it only be done individually per ledger?

In R3, this was possible because it was done by movement type, as it allowed limiting the movement type by valuation area. In S4, movement types cannot be limited to valuation areas.

Our go-live date is January 2026.

Thanks and best regards.

Has anyone else run across this and what was your solution?

Kelie

entry.title: Re: SAP B1 Web Client 2508
entry.content:
Hi dimtriant,
If a field is defined as linked to a UDO, it'll be in the right size to contain the exact key size for that UDO.
This means it is not suitable, and not designed to simply change the CFL to multi-selection.
In such a case, you'll need to think of an alternative solution (depending on your scenario and UX preferences).

entry.title: Re: Information missing when activating Identity Authenti...
entry.content:
Hello @teresa_costa , hope you`re doing well

I don`t know exactly the kind of information is missing, but I`d like to suggest something that I found on my research:

Verify Integration Prerequisites Ensure that the Initiate SAP Cloud Identity Services - Identity Authentication Integration for Learning-Only Users process has completed successfully in the Upgrade Center. This process should have automatically populated most of these values.

Check Integration Status Verify that initiateIASMigration is set to true in System Administration > Configuration > System Configuration > SAP CLOUD IDENTITY SERVICES. This confirms the integration process has been initiated properly.

In case of doesn`t work, let`s here the Initiating Learning Identity Authentication Migration | SAP Help Portal documentation.

I hope this helps
Regards
Daniel Romanin

* Please consider mark this answer as solution if your question was properly answered

entry.content:

entry.title: Re: Urgent! Looking for help from Learning Admin. with kn...
entry.content:
Hello @MichelleWest, hope you`re doing well

This kind of assistance you can use the documentation in the Admin Learning Manual >> Learning Administration | SAP Help Portal

Here a resume (Generate with our SAP IA Joule) >>

Creating Courses (Items) with Published Content

Step 1: Create Learning Items

  1. Navigate to Learning Administration ‚Üí Learning Activities ‚Üí Items
  2. Select Add New and choose:
    • Item Classification: Select appropriate classification
    • Locale: Choose the language/region
    • Item Type: Select from available types (e.g., CRSE for courses)

Step 2: Add Online Content to Items For courses with published content, you'll need to add content objects:

  1. Go to the Online Content tab of your item
  2. Add multiple Content Objects/Content Packages to a single item as needed
  3. Configure the item to be marked as completed upon successful completion of any one content object (for multilingual scenarios)
  4. Supported content formats include:
    • SCORM (versions 1.2, 2004, or 2004 4Ed)
    • AICC (Aviation Industry CBT Committee)
    • Browser and document-type launch methods

Step 3: Configure Item Details

  • Set appropriate security domains
  • Configure completion criteria
  • Add descriptions and metadata
  • Set up any required approval processes if needed

Assigning Courses to Specific Groups

Method 1: Using Assignment Profiles (Recommended for Bulk Assignment)

  1. Create Assignment Profiles 

    • Go to Learning Administration ‚Üí Manage User Learning ‚Üí Assignment Profiles
    • Click Add New to create a new assignment profile
    • Define rules that create a pool of learners by learner attributes (e.g., department, job role, location)

  2. Configure Assignment Rules 

    • On the Rules tab, set up criteria to identify your target group
    • Use Download Existing Users to verify the current pool of learners matches your expectations

  3. Add Items to Assignment Profile 

    • Go to the Items tab
    • Click Add Items to select the courses you want to assign
    • Execute changes to complete the assignment

Method 2: Using Libraries for Group-Based Access

  1. Create Libraries 

    • Navigate to Learning Activities ‚Üí Libraries
    • Click Add New
    • Provide a unique Library ID and descriptive name
    • Set appropriate Security Domain for administrative access

  2. Add Courses to Libraries

    • Open your created items/courses
    • Navigate to the Libraries tab
    • Select Add Libraries and choose the appropriate library

  3. Assign Libraries to User Groups 

    • Use Assignment Profiles to assign libraries to specific user groups
    • Go to Manage User Learning ‚Üí Assignment Profiles
    • On the Libraries tab, add the relevant libraries
    • Users will see the union of all courses from all assigned libraries

I hope this helps
Regards
Daniel Romanin

entry.title: Innovation in Action: The SAP Category Management Success Story in Brazil's logistics sector
entry.content:
In November/2025, one of the largest logistics companies in Brazil embarked on a transformation journey by implementing and GOING LIVE with SAP Ariba Category Management.

The project represented a pioneering milestone in the country, introducing a new approach to strategic category management and reinforcing the organization‚Äôs commitment to innovation and operational excellence.

With complex processes and large-scale operations, the implementation was challenging ‚Äî yet highly enriching in terms of shared knowledge and team collaboration.

Through well-defined phases and clearly established responsibilities, the project was executed smoothly, on schedule, and with strong engagement from both business and technical teams.

The Spend Data Sync integration marked a significant step toward analytical intelligence, with future plans to evolve into the Spend Control Tower. Additionally, the adoption of Guided Sourcing brings the organization closer to achieving the Triple Crown concept, expanding strategic impact and operational efficiency.

Artificial intelligence played a key role in accelerating the creation of initiatives and action plans, reducing response times and strengthening data-driven decision-making:

  • Category Segmentation
    This tool helps to document category-specific strategy details and obtain approval by clearly outlining how you plan to address business requirements and achieve defined goals.
    Generative AI for Segmenting a Category | SAP Help Portal

  • Cost Structure
    Provides a better insight into the cost structure components, cost distribution, and cost drivers associated with the purchasing category.
    Generative AI for Creating a Cost Structure | SAP Help Portal

  • Market Dynamics (Porter's 5)
    Provides a comprehensive understanding of the competitive dynamics surrounding the category ‚Äî including supplier power, buyer power, threat of substitutes, threat of new entrants, and industry rivalry.
    Generative AI for Plotting the Market Dynamics Chart | SAP Help Portal

  • Category Strategy Details
    Links strategic insights with operational execution for better decision-making and measurable outcomes.
    Generating AI-Based Strategy Recommendations | SAP Help Portal

  • Approval Document
    AI-enhanced summaries provide a quick overview, highlighting key points without the need to manually review details across all sections of the approval documents.
    Generative AI for Approval Document | SAP Help Portal

Feedback during testing and post go-live was consistently positive, highlighting how complete, versatile, and business-aligned the SAP solution proved to be. Within just two days after activation, plans were already underway for a ramp-up of new categories and broader stakeholder engagement.

The following key success factors were identified as essential to ensure effective implementation, alignment with business objectives, and long-term sustainability of the solution:

1. Governance

  • Clear definition of roles and responsibilities.

  • Governance model with decision-making and follow-up forums.

2. Data and Category Structure

  • Consolidated and accurately classified spend data.

  • Dedicated data specialist with business and analytical knowledge.

  • Appropriate level of granularity aligned with business needs.

3. Strategy and Methodology

  • Clearly defined and measurable objectives.

  • Analytical and collaboration tools integrated into the process as needed.

  • Customization according to the Category Managers‚Äô daily operations and organizational context.

  • Engage in close coordination with the SAP Support Team.

4. Stakeholder Engagement

  • Involvement of the business areas during the whole project.

  • Collaboration among technical, business, and procurement teams in strategy development.

  • Continuous and transparent communication on results and next steps.

This project stands as a success story of how innovation, partnership, and a clear sense of purpose can transform the way organizations plan, negotiate, and manage their categories - since the solution was fully customized according to their business needs.

Category Management is not just a tool ‚Äî it‚Äôs a new strategic mindset, and this journey marks the beginning of a promising future for category management in Brazil.

As the implementer of this great success, I invite you to explore more about SAP Category Management ‚Äî and discover how it can drive innovation, efficiency, and strategic value for your business:
https://www.sap.com/products/spend-management/category-management-software.html

Beatriz Calesco
SAP Ariba & Category Management Consultant

entry.title: What's new for Production Planning in SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud 2025
entry.content:
SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud has been officially released, and many new feature were delivered for production planning. From UI improvements to the MRP Cockpit Fiori apps to new Business Add-Ins available for MRP and production orders, this blog provides an overview of those new features that are available in the latest SAP S/4HANA release.

Improvements for MRP Cockpit Fiori Apps

Several improvements were delivered for the MRP Cockpit Fiori Apps Monitor Material Coverage - Net Segments (F0247A), Monitor Material Coverage - Net and Individual Segments (F2101A) and Manage Material Coverage (F0251A), bringing additional functionalities that util now were only available in the Stock/Requirements List, and also innovations that will mimic features originally available in the MRP List. 

Rescheduling and Cancelling of Proposals

Fiori Apps Monitor Material Coverage - Net Segments (F0247A) and Monitor Material Coverage - Net and Individual Segments (F2101A) were enhanced to display information about the number of rescheduling proposals that were generated for a specific material.

These apps will now display of the number of rescheduling proposals, and new filters were also introduced to allow users to filter for materials with specific rescheduling messages. The following figure shows the new fields and the new filters in the app Monitor Material Coverage.


Figure 1: Rescheduling Proposals in Monitor Material Coverage

Fiori app Manage Material Coverage has been also enhanced with new actions that will help users to resolve coverage issues and make sure requirements can be met as planned:

  • Proposals to reschedule MRP elements to an earlier date (reschedule in)
  • Proposals to reschedule MRP elements to a later date (reschedule out)
  • Proposals to cancel MRP elements (cancel process)

The following figure shows and example of the action Reschedule Out, for a purchase order with a rescheduling message:


Figure 2: Rescheduling actions in Manage Material Coverage

 

Last MRP Run

Fiori Apps Monitor Material Coverage and Manage Material Coverage were also enhanced to show the date of the last MRP Run, and to allow users to filter for material segments using the date of the Last MRP Run. The following figures show the filter and the field in Monitor Material Coverage and Manage Material Coverage.


Figure 3: Last MRP Run in Monitor Material Coverage

 


Figure 4: Last MRP Run in Manage Material Coverage

 

Planning Time Fence and Manual Firming Date

Another enhancement to the Monitor Material Coverage and Manage Material Coverage Fiori apps was the introduction of the Planning Time Fence and the possibility to set or change a Manual Time Fence.

New filters and columns for MRP type and planning time fence were added into the Material Coverage app, as we can see in the Figure below.


Figure 5: Planning Time Fence and MRP Type in Monitor Material Coverage

 

As we can see in Figure 6, Fiori App Manage Material Coverage now can show the Planning Time Fence, and users will also have the possibility to edit the Planning Time Fence.  


Figure 6: Planning Time Fence in Manage Material Coverage


Accept MRP Run Result

SAP S/4HANA 2025 also introduced a new feature called Accept the MRP results, allowing the planner to mark materials for which the MRP result has been already evaluated.

A new filter has been already introduced in Fiori App Monitor Material Coverage, so that the planner can filter for material segments where the MRP result has been already accepted or not, and there is also a new column called MRP Result Accepted, as we can see in Figure 7.


Figure 7: MRP Result Accepted in Fiori App Monitor Material Coverage

 

Fiori app Manage Material Coverage has also been enhanced with a button that allows the planner to Accept the MRP Results, or revoke the Acceptance of MRP results, as shown in Figure 8.  


Figure 8: Button Accept MRP Result in Fiori App Manage Material Coverage

 

This feature has been also introduced in both collect and individual access of the Stock/Requirements List (transactions MD04 and MD07), as I described in my blog Accept/Revoke MRP Run results in the Stock/Requirements List and MRP Fiori Apps, and it is available for earlier releases, as described in the blog. However, only as of SAP S/4HANA 2025 users will have the ability to mass Accept and Revoke the MRP Results from the Collective Access of the Stock/Requirements List, as shown in Figure 9.


Figure 9: Mass acceptance of MRP results in the Stock/Requirements List.

 

Downporting new features to SAP S/4HANA 2023

Some of the new features listed above can be also introduce in SAP S/4HANA 2023 with the implementation of the following notes:

No.

SAP Note

Description

1

3586336

SAP- Production Planning- Supporting Features- Rescheduling Proposals, Planning time fence and Last MRP Run.

2

3592002

SAP- Production Planning- Rescheduling Proposals, Planning time fence and Last MRP Run in Monitor material coverage- Net & Individual segments Fiori Application ( F2101A )

3

3592003

SAP- Production Planning- Rescheduling Proposals, Planning time fence and Last MRP Run in Monitor material coverage- Net segments ( F0247A )

4

3591572

SAP- Production Planning- Rescheduling Proposals, Planning time fence and Last MRP Run in Manage material coverage Fiori Application (F0251A)

 

 

Material Requirements Planning

Technical improvements were also delivered for MRP Live in SAP S/4HANA 2025, including new BAdIs and the improvements in the integration of documents with PP/DS and IBP.

Business Transaction Events in MRP Live

SAP S/4HANA introduced a new feature in MRP Live, that allows the creation of business transaction events (BTEs) for business documents created within MRP Live (e.g. planned orders, purchase requisitions, scheduling agreements and stock transfer requisitions) enabling post-processing steps for other applications like PP/DS, IBP.

In previous releases, materials for which documents had to be integrated to PP/DS or IBP had to be planned by MRP Live in ABAP instead of HANA, because documents generated or changed by MRP were integrated by means of an RFC. With the new integration using BTE events, those materials can be planned in HANA, which an improved MRP Live performance.

For example, if we activate Advanced Planning for a material, and we choose the option PP/DS Display Only for the scope limitation, this material would be planned in ABAP by MRP Live. As of SAP S/4HANA 2025, we can use BTE events to integrate those documents, allowing the material to be planned in HANA.

The setting to activate the integration with BTE can be found in transaction PPHMRPSET, as we can see in Figure 10.


Figure 10: Setting to activate Business Transaction Events in MRP Live.

New BAdIs for MRP

  • Adjustment of Planned Order Component Data during BOM Explosion (PPH_PLDORD_COMP_ADJ):  This new BAdI allows you to modify the storage location and production supply area of components in planned orders during BOM explosion in the following processes:

    • Planning run of material requirements planning and master production scheduling

    • Manual planned order creation
    • Backflush for repetitive manufacturing without planned order

  • Additional Parameters for Navigation Profile (MD_NAVIGATION_ADJUSTüòû With this new BAdI you can change the parameter IDs for transactions which are maintained in Customizing activity Define Navigation Profiles. Navigation profiles enable you to navigate faster and more flexibly between transactions, and with the new BAdI you can use more than only three parameter IDs.

 

 

Shop-Floor Control

Besides the already mentioned improvements for MRP, SAP S/4HANA 2025 also brought improvements for Shop-Floor Control, including a better handling for partial consumption posted from EWM, and new technical objects, like RAP Business Objects and Data Products. 

 

Partial Consumption and Split for Error Handling for Automatic Goods Movement, COGI

SAP S/4HANA 2025 also introduced a new feature that enables partial retrograde goods issue for non-batched and non-serialized components in embedded SAP Extended Warehouse Management, checking availability in the bin of the production supply area during the manufacturing process

This feature allows postprocessing of error records from automatic goods movements (COGI transaction) only for unavailable quantities of components, and it works for discrete and repetitive manufacturing. It will enable as-is partial goods movement between SAP EWM and production during synchronous goods movement processes, increasing PSA stock control, reducing clerical work, and improving accuracy of stock data. Figure 11 shows the setting use to activate this new feature in the Production Scheduling Profile.


Figure 11: Goods Issue Quantity Split setting in the Production Scheduling Profile

 

Example:

  • 3 EA of component KOMPK1-01 are available in the bin in production supply area, as shown in Figure 12.


Figure 12: 3 EA of component available in the Supply Area.

 

  • Figure 13 shows that the backflush of the component for a production order requires 12 EA,


Figure 13: Backflush requires 12 EA of the component.

 

  • When we post the backflush for the production order, 3 EA of component KOMPK1-01 are issued, as shown in Figure 14.


Figure 14: Backflush was posted and the consumption of 3 EA has been posted.

 

  • As we have activated the Goods Issue Quantity Split in the Production Scheduling Profile, the remaining quantity of 9 EA went into Postprocessing of Error Records from Automatic Goods Movements (transaction COGI), as shown in Figure 15.

 

Figure 15: Postprocessing of the remaining quantity in COGI

 

BAdI for Initialization of Order Component on Creation

With the new Business Add-In (BAdI), Order Component - Initialization on Creation (PPH_PRODORD_COMP_ADJ) you can fill the material planning relevance and the bulk indicator at the order component (reservation) level when creating an order.

 

RAP Business Objects for Production Orders

SAP S/4HANA 2025 also brought new technical objects that will help customers to make sure that custom developments are clean core compatible. New RAP Business Objects were introduced for Production Orders, Process Orders and Routings, enabling cloud-native APIs for SAP BusinessObjects in production execution and on-stack extensibility for Manufacturing.


Figure 16: New Production and Process Order RAP BOs 

 

Manufacturing Data Products

A SAP data product is a pre-packaged dataset that is ready for consumption by applications for analytics, AI, and other business intelligence purposes. A comprehensive set of ERP data products sourced from SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition is now available, providing structured insights into manufacturing execution:

  • Production version
  • Work center
  • Manufacturing codes
  • Production confirmation
  • Production order
  • Enterprise resource capacity
  • Production routing]

SAP API Hub provides more information about the Manufacturing Data Products.

Figure 17: Manufacturing Data Products

 

See also:

Planning Time Fence and Last MRP Run

Accept Planning Result of MRP Run

Rescheduling Proposals for MRP Elements

Business Transaction Events in MRP Live

BAdI for Adjustment of Planned Order Component Data during BOM Explosion

BAdI for Allowing Additional Parameters for Navigation Profile

BAdI for Initialization of Order Component on Creation

Partial Goods Issue for Component Consumption in Manufacturing

API Hub

 

Brought to you by the SAP S/4HANA Regional Implementation Group

entry.title: Eat your vegetables: The real key to transformation success
entry.content:
According to research released in January 2025, companies undertake three transformations a year on average. This finding confirmed something SAP LeanIX co-founder Andr√© Christ wrote about way back in 2021: The era of digital transformation is over and we have entered the era of continuous transformation.

At the time, Andr√© was simply highlighting something that should have been obvious: Digital transformation itself was never one and done. As an idea that entered the business lexicon around 2000, digital transformation initially referred to using digital technologies (read: computers and later the internet) to reimagine and reengineer the way businesses work.

Of course, digital technologies continually evolve. So long as digital transformation meant ‚Äúuse digital technologies in ways you didn‚Äôt before,‚Äù that transformation was never really going to have an end. There was always some new digital something coming down the pike offering a new, and presumably better, way to do things.

Now that we‚Äôve reached the age of AI, the continuous nature of transformation is apparent. Not only has AI rapidly evolved, but it‚Äôs clear that we are only at the beginning of this r/evolution. We've effectively entered singularity territory, which, for those unfamiliar with the term, means that predicting the future isn‚Äôt becoming more challenging so much as impossible.

Which raises the question: How do you transform if the future is unknowable?

Go with what you know

The simple answer is: Focus on what you know‚Äìor could know in principle.

I say ‚Äúcould know in principle‚Äù because, as it turns out, companies often struggle to know a lot of the details about their business. How many licenses do we have for Microsoft Office? What are my top ten applications in terms of usage rates? In my most common applications, where do people get stuck? We have a documented procure-to-pay process, how closely do people follow it? When they instead pursue workarounds, what do those workarounds look like? And so on.

At the end of the day, what is your business actually? The most straightforward answer is "the things that your employees do to deliver goods and services to your customers along with everything they do to keep the lights on and keep you out of trouble."

All the things that people do, that is, the processes they follow to serve customers or help keep you solvent and out of court, depend on technology. That means your business consists of your people, your processes, and your technology.

This is hardly a new perspective, I realize. I‚Äôve been to many a conference where people talked about the importance of aligning ‚Äúpeople, process, and technology.‚Äù I even once worked for a consultancy that promised to help you optimize your ‚Äúpeople, process, and technology.‚Äù

Now, in the business transformation management solution area at SAP, we help companies manage every dimension of transformation. What are those dimensions? Well, we call them ‚Äúpeople, process, applications, and data,‚Äù but if you combined applications and data under the rubric ‚Äútechnology,‚Äù we‚Äôre basically saying the same thing.

The problem is that companies struggle to easily account for these dimensions, especially as the company grows. For example, there is some evidence that organizations underestimate the number of applications they have by 1.7x and the amount they spend on them by 3x.

To put this a little more starkly, I once spoke to a woman whose company had grown rapidly through acquisition. It reached a point where she discovered the company was paying $500K for software no one had touched in two years.

As it turns out, those kind of numbers may be a drop in the bucket. WalkMe‚Äôs research, for example, found that companies with over ten thousand employees waste, on average, $16 million a year on unused software.

The same goes for business processes. While statistics vary, the general consensus is that only about half of companies have a formal business process management practice, most instances of process non-conformance go unreported, and a huge percentage (84%) still rely on manual processes for data entry and things like account reconciliation.  

The problem is, as I mentioned at the top, all these companies struggling to account for their technology, monitor and improve software usage, or gain any insight into business process execution also find themselves in the midst of three or more transformations a year!

And without reliable data on the current state of the business, transforming that business becomes extremely challenging.

That‚Äôs why I have some very specific advice for business and technology leaders: Eat your vegetables.

What does ‚ÄúEat your vegetables‚Äù mean?

I worked for a CMO who once remarked that our content was ‚Äúeat your vegetables‚Äù content. He meant that our content (for which I was responsible, by the way) emphasized what our customers, and, frankly, reasonable people in general, should do to be more successful.

That is, just like a doctor might tell you to eat your vegetables if you want to stay healthy, we talked about how to create and maintain a healthy business using our solutions.

The problem with ‚Äúeat your vegetables‚Äù content is that it can feel preachy, I suppose, and maybe a little dry. But that doesn‚Äôt mean there is any problem with eating your vegetables! In fact, if you want to avoid heart disease and other ailments, eating vegetables is a great way to do it.

So, what about eating your vegetables in the context of business transformation? What does that look like?

As I said, if you want to successfully and continuously execute business transformation, your planning needs to begin with the as-is state. It‚Äôs literally the starting point of any transformation you undertake. Of course, the day you decide to pursue or initiate a specific transformation is not the day you want to start inventorying your applications, mining your processes, and tracking digital adoption.

Sadly, this is precisely where many companies find themselves, with only 37% strongly agreeing that senior leadership has access to reliable data regarding the business process and IT landscape and some 43% of completed transformations are considered ‚Äúnot worth the effort.‚Äù

Transformation and your future state aside, insight into people, process, and technology can only have a positive impact on performance today. That‚Äôs why it‚Äôs like eating your vegetables. It keeps you healthy in the present.

Now, I understand why people don‚Äôt eat their vegetables. They‚Äôre gross. Ok, sometimes they are delicious. But, still, you often have to prepare them (washing, cooking, seasoning, etc.) before they are palatable. So, eating vegetables can be more of a hassle than eating a burger and fries.

I supposed people don't eat their vegetables in the business transformation context. After all, implementing the right solutions, collecting data, analyzing it, and applying what you find to improving the business takes time and effort.  Plus, it costs money.

At the same time, if you don‚Äôt have acute issues, that is, if your business is doing reasonably well, investing in eating your vegetables, so to speak, can seem, if not extravagant, at least a bit ‚Äúextra,‚Äù as the kids say.

In other words, if you like eating fried food and ice cream, but are in relatively good health, eating vegetables may feel like you‚Äôre making a sacrifice. Why? You only live once!

Same goes for your business. If it feels like digging into understanding your current state and uncovering areas for improvement will simply distract you from serving customers, then kicking that can down the road can actually make business sense.

But, here‚Äôs the thing. You are already pursuing transformation. It‚Äôs part of doing business. And that isn‚Äôt going to stop. Eating your vegetables, then, is key to doing something you are already doing better (faster, more efficiently, consistently, etc.).

So, why is it? Why don‚Äôt companies invest in understanding the business as it functions today? Not only will it improve performance, but it will also prepare you to transform, not just in the future, but today, when, research shows, you are actively engaged in transformation.

What gets in the way? It can't be the tools or know-how. We have both! Is it possible that business leaders misunderstand the complexity of transformation? Seems unlikely. Do they see it as too hard? Not worth the effort?  

What is the issue? Enquiring minds want to know!

entry.content:
Dear gurus,

 

we are having some trouble concerning partner determination for cross-company stock transfer, especially with return shipments.

 

The situation is this: Company code A sells a material to company code B.

 

We create a stoc-transfer-order (STO), a delivery note and the bill. In the bill (type IV intercompany Billing), partners Sold-to-party, Bill-to-party and Payer is the customer number of company code B. Just as expected.

 

BUT when we try to return materials from company code B to Company code A, we create a STO with an item with ‚ÄúReturns Item‚Äù picked. In the delivery created (type NCR Ret.StTranspOrd CC), partner Ship-to Party is the customer number of company code A.

This seems ok, but when we continue to create the bill (type IG Internal Credit Memo), the partners Sold-to Party, Bill-to Party and Payer is the customer number of Company code A (!) as well.

This just seems wrong and differs greatly from the original bill. Of course, this causes further problems with creating output documents, because company code A is printed as the recipient of the credit memo, which is just nonsense.

 

Any ideas on how to change this? I do not think we changed the standard customizing here, which is even more weird.

Any suggestions would be greatly appreciated.

 

Thank you
Jens

entry.title: Re: The URL parameter to display a "Specific" Order/Numbe...
entry.content: Just to add an update from what I've found, the #PurchaseOrder-display semantic model-action link that just displays ME23n doesn't accept a purchase order or requisition number as a parameter.  I think this is probably because of the way ME23N doesn't bring you to an initial filter screen, and instead makes you click a button to open a different PO.  Instead, use #PurchaseOrder-displayFactSheet and then the PurchaseOrder=XXXXXXXX parameter to filter to a specific document.

entry.title: From Legacy to AI-Powered: RISE Transformation Revolution with Joule for developers, ABAP AI capabil
entry.content:
Meet John: From ABAP Developer to AI-Powered Transformation Leader

Remember John? He started as a seasoned developer who was initially skeptical about AI assistance in ABAP development. His journey began with simple "quick questions" and real-time coding help through SAP Joule for Developers. Over the past months, we've watched John evolve from struggling with basic syntax queries to confidently generating complete Fiori Cloud applications using the OData UI Service from Scratch Wizard, implementing intelligent business logic with RAP Predict Business Logic, and seamlessly integrating external services through AI-powered OData consumption. What started as curiosity about AI-assisted coding has transformed John into his organization's go-to expert for next-generation ABAP development.

Now, John's mastery of ABAP AI development has reached new heights. From generating complete applications to implementing intelligent business logic, he's now tackling his organization's most complex challenge: transforming their legacy systems for SAP S/4HANA Cloud readiness. With the latest SAP Joule for Developers capabilities, what once seemed like an insurmountable migration project has become an intelligent, guided transformation journey.

The Transformation Challenge: From Legacy to S/4HANA Ready

John's organization faces a common but daunting reality: thousands of custom programs, reports, and interfaces built over 15 years need S/4HANA compatibility assessment and adaptation. Traditional approaches would require months of manual analysis, documentation diving, and painstaking code rewrites. But with the enhanced Custom Code Migration AI Assistant included in the latest Joule for developers, ABAP AI capabilities delivery for S/4HANA Private Cloud Edition version 2025, John is revolutionizing how his team approaches this transformation. See here a demo.

Advanced Code Analysis with AI-Powered Intelligence

Documentation Chat: Instant Expert Knowledge

When John encounters complex S/4HANA simplification scenarios, he no longer spends hours searching through SAP Help or simplification SAP Notes and cookbooks. Using the /docs command in Joule chat, he directly queries SAP's comprehensive knowledge base:

"How does MATNR field length impact the code"

Instantly, Joule provides detailed explanations of technical field length changes and code adaptation requirements. The AI doesn't just return generic documentation, it contextualizes responses based on John's specific migration scenarios, highlighting the most relevant simplification items and their business impact.

The "Explain" Revolution: Understanding Legacy Code at Scale

John's team inherited a critical 700-line sales reporting program with no documentation. Previously, understanding such code would take days of analysis. Now, using the enhanced "Explain" functionality, John selects the entire program and asks Joule to break it down.

The AI provides comprehensive insights into:

  • Business Purpose: Explanation of what the program accomplishes with the possibility to ask for deep dive.
  • Processing Logic: Step-by-step breakdown of the program flow also with the possibility to ask for detailed insights
  • Data Dependencies: Identification of tables, views, and external interfaces

Intelligent Issue Resolution with ATC Findings Analysis

Beyond Error Detection: AI-Powered Problem Solving

When John runs ATC checks with S/4HANA readiness variants, traditional tools simply flag issues. The new "Explain ATC Findings" capability transforms error messages into actionable intelligence.

For a critical database operation issue‚Äî"S/4HANA Database Operation: DELETE on FAGLFLEXA05"‚ÄîJoule doesn't just identify the problem. It provides:

  1. Root Cause Analysis: "FAGLFLEXA05 appears to be a General Ledger line item table that has been affected by S/4HANA's simplified finance model"
  2. Business Impact: Explanation of why this change matters for financial reporting
  3. Resolution Strategy: Step-by-step guidance using recommended SAP APIs
  4. Code Examples: Practical ABAP snippets showing the correct implementation approach

  

Proactive Code Adaptation Proposals

The upcoming code proposal functionality, planed for Q1 2026 will take John's transformation journey even further. Instead of just explaining issues, Joule will generate complete, S/4HANA-ready code adaptations. John can preview proposed changes, understand their impact, and implement solutions with confidence.

 

The Complete Transformation Ecosystem

John's workflow now encompasses the entire legacy-to-cloud transformation lifecycle:

  • Analysis Phase (Released): Documentation chat provides instant access to S/4HANA knowledge 
  • Understanding Phase (Released): Explain functionality reveals legacy code business logic and technical dependencies
  • Assessment Phase (Released): ATC findings explanation transforms error lists into strategic migration roadmaps 
  • Adaptation Phase (Planned): Code proposals deliver ready-to-implement S/4HANA compatible solutions

Real-World Impact: Transformation at Enterprise Scale

"Six months ago, analyzing a single custom program took our team days," John reports to his CTO. "Today, I can understand complex legacy code in minutes, get detailed S/4HANA compatibility analysis instantly, and receive step-by-step resolution guidance for every issue. The productivity gain is incredible."

The quantifiable benefits are remarkable:

  • Analysis Time: Reduced from days to hours per program
  • Documentation Research: From days to minutes for complex scenarios
  • Error Resolution: From trial-and-error to guided, intelligent solutions
  • Code Quality: AI-generated adaptations follow SAP best practices automatically

Accelerating SAP Transformation with Enhanced Custom Code Migration Analysis

Listening to the TechEd announcement John is excited to learn about the significant enhancement of Custom Code Migration Application, built on SAP BTP ABAP Environment (Steampunk), scheduled for Q1 next year. This powerful application will incorporate advanced legacy code explain and ATC explain capabilities, providing project managers and functional consultants with unprecedented visibility into their SAP transformation journey. The Custom Code Migration Application seamlessly connects to any legacy SAP ERP On-Premise system, enabling comprehensive migration analysis that goes beyond surface-level assessments to deliver deep, contextual insights into custom code behavior and business logic.

Looking ahead, the roadmap includes two additional game-changing use cases that will further streamline your S/4HANA transformation. The Fit-to-Standard Analysis feature will intelligently evaluate whether existing custom developments are now covered by native S/4HANA Private Cloud functionality, providing clear recommendations on which customizations can be retired or simplified. Complementing this, our Clean Core Recommender will proactively identify deviations from SAP's clean core best practices and deliver actionable guidance to align your system architecture with modern standards. Together, these capabilities will empower organizations to make informed decisions about their custom code portfolio while ensuring a future-ready, maintainable SAP landscape that maximizes the value of their S/4HANA investment.

 Looking Forward: The Hybrid AI Service Revolution

The promise of SAP's revolutionary side-by-side ABAP AI service represents the next transformation frontier. This groundbreaking approach will bring cutting-edge AI capabilities to older SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition releases, eliminating the wait for upgrades while accelerating innovation across hybrid landscapes.

John's journey from struggling with ABAP syntax to leading enterprise-scale S/4HANA transformations demonstrates the profound impact of AI-assisted development. With each new capability, the boundary between complex legacy challenges and intelligent, automated solutions continues to blur.

Ready to transform your legacy landscape? Explore the Custom Code Migration AI Assistant capabilities and discover how natural language conversations can revolutionize your S/4HANA journey.

 

The ABAP AI revolution continues to evolve‚Äîand John's story is just beginning. Stay tuned for the next chapter as we unveil the hybrid AI service innovations that will redefine enterprise development across every SAP landscape.

entry.title: Re: Payroll Canada Year-End 2025
entry.content:
SAP team - FYI - this KBA "3681231 - ROE is not generated for reasons linked to custom Personnel Actions" was just released but it appears to be inaccurate or misleading -  

This statement in the KBA   "ROE is only triggered by action (infotype 0) if the Employment Status (STAT2) is different to 3 (Active)" is not correct. The ROE will get generated if those custom personnel actions /reasons are configured appropriately in T5K1E / ROE configuration even if the Employment status is 3 (Active).
